results.title: The Shadowers
results.brief_description: This three screen video installation creates a series of disquieting tableaus that present visions of three characters engaged in a game like narrative and whose roles and identities shift and blur between attacker and victim and all that could be the same in between. In an articulation of a ‘schizophrenic understanding of the self’ Tichacek presents an image of oscillating inner world’s where physical and mental experience fluctuate and escape simple definition in the parameters of physical and emotional manipulations and violence (Exhibition proposal). In a thematic echo of and engagement with technological advancements in bodily modification, the victim, played by the artist, is submitted to a range of intrusive and physical molding actions at the hands of the other characters, set in lush outdoor settings as well as in a dark and clinical interior. Suspended in a triangular fashion and surrounding a sculptural object, the viewer can move between and behind the synchronised screens, the physical and psychological shifts of identity featured in the video mirrored in the viewer’s own fluctuating experience of the work as they become variously immersed in or distanced from the disturbingly beautiful and new but fragile ‘prosthetic’ space the game narrative articulates. Static and inarticulate frequencies, or white noise, layer the visuals in place of the characters’ speech and screams and create an aural sense of distortion and displacement for the viewer in the use of surround sound.

results.title: Deakin's pipe dream
results.brief_description:
A montage of archival photographic images superimposed with live action footage to present a vision of Federation and irrigation in the Sunraysia region of Victoria. Without dialogue and accompanied only by background sound effects.
Developed during the Alfred Deakin Federation Project, 2001 and supported by the Centenary of Federation Victoria and the Community Support Fund through the Victorian Federation Grants Scheme, and the Mildura City Council.

results.title: Cultural stories
results.brief_description: There are 140 cultural groups living in Greater Dandenong, Victoria. To celebrate this cultural diversity this short documentary film presents Maria (Hungarian), Andreas (Greek Cypriot) and Rosanna (Chilean) as they each tell their personal story of their own background, family, culture and migrant experience to the sounds of traditional music and images of family photographs.

results.title: Festival of kites
results.brief_description: Sponsored by the City of Darebin, this short video documents the Festival of Kites, organized by the North Eastern Melbourne Chinese Association and by the Australian Kite Association. An all-day event held in parklands in Preston, this multicultural event includes performances by comedians, Indian dancers and a Chinese Choir.

results.title: 70 years at Brunswick Baths
results.brief_description: Brunswick - Harry Ivory, a fitness fanatic, a boxer, boxing trainer and local legend has been attending the Brunswick Baths since the day it opened in 1928. Part of a longer documentary about Harry’s life, this 4 minute film was made especially for the MAP project and focuses on the importance to him of the Brunswick Baths and the Baths community. Harry loves the place and often says it is the Baths that keep him going.

results.title: Froggie's gone
results.brief_description: This warmly comic documentary is about Beryl from Brunswick whose prized garden frog is stolen from her verandah. Very soon the police and the neighbours are on the trail of the thieves, everyone wanting to do their bit to ensure that Froggie comes back home where he belongs. This acclaimed short film was made by Beryl’s niece as a celebration of community, and is an example of how remembering an episode from your life can make a wonderful piece of film.
